answers.answer: I'm not pregnant, but just stopped to give my advice. Number one, first and foremost...you do need to calm down, don't worry so much. You're putting unneeded stress on your body by worrying so much. I was scared SH*Tless when I was pregnant, because I was so worried about miscarriage, still birth, preeclampsia, and all the things that could go wrong...it did me no good to worry, and I'm sure everything will be fine for you. It's not much longer until you have your u/s and I'm sure some of your worries will go away once you have had it, but for now just try to relax and enjoy having just the one baby to worry about...cause pretty soon you'll have twice the stress, crying, diapers (if DD isn't potty trained)...so enjoy your daughter, and giving her all of your attention. And IF there's a need for worry, take it one day at a time...look at the worries you have for just today, and don't think about the future just yet, you're living today right now, not tomorrow, and not yesterday. So enjoy today.

I can remember going into my pregnancy with my son I was having very similar fears, but Ihad miscarried only once and that was at 4 weeks. I got pregnant the following month after and was really not prepared for the worry and stress! You have a right to worry and I dontthink you are overreacting considering what you have been through, but you do need to try to relax due to the stress you are putting on your body and more importantly on the baby!You said you have an ultrasound next week on the 17th right? Please keep me posted and if you need to chat you can always PM me just totalk or vent! I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers! God Bless!

It's normal to worry, especially when you've been through the devastation of a miscarriage. Every worst-case scenario runs through your mind. My only advice is to enjoy every single moment you are blessed to be pregnant with this little one. It's all you can do because everything else is out of your hands.Even once you get that first sonogram report that all is well you'll probably find something else to worry about. You're not innocent to the problems that can arise during pregnancy, so that makes it all the more difficult. That's why I encourage you to enjoy every moment and milestone of your pregnancy! Better to look back and say, "I had a great attitude" then to look back and say "I regret not enjoying it more".And just because your last pregnancy was full of so many issues--- it does NOT mean you'll have those same issues. Each pregnancy is unique and different. Take it easy and sending some e-Hugs your way!

Thanks girl!  My husband is being super awesome....we have basically put me back on bedrest until I see the doc and hear otherwise....just to be on the safe side.  He has been absolutely amazing and supportive throughout this whole ordeal.I will keep you posted when i find out!

Well,  I saw the dr yesterday and I am happy to report that Baby #2 is healthy!  :)  The doctor recommended I take it easy to be on the safe side with this one....Not full fledged bed rest...but just the recommendation to do as little as possible until we make it into the 2nd trimester!Just wanted to let everyone know!
that's great news!!! congratulations...and do take it easy and enjoy it.

Glad to see the post with the good news!  Anxiety can indeed make things worse.  You may want to consider some relaxation techniques.  One thing I've found helpful (I'm also an anxious person) is to think about being on a train where there's someone else driving (your body) and since you can't control it, you may as well take a deep breath, look out the window, and think positively about all the wonderful possibilites.  Good luck!

question: Hey ladies....I have had a very emotional weekend...with many things that have made me worry more than usual...(which is ALOT!)  So...I thought I would vent to you all...and if any of you are in the same boat....lets get together and use the opportunity to talk!I am 8 weeks pregnant with my 5th pregnancy.  I had 3 miscarriages and one successful pregnancy which gave us our DD in July of 07.  Needless to say, I enter each pregnancy with MUCH worry.  I have been diagnosed with hyperemesis with this pregnancy...and I am on Protonix, Reglan, Phenergan and Zofran for nausea/vomiting....and can basically only keep down liquids right now.  With my daughter I had a subchorionic uterine hemorrage and was also diagnosed with low progesterone.  I was on progesterone suppositories (I am on these as well with this pregnancy) and was also on bed rest for 8 months out of the 9.   I went into preterm labor several times which was stopped with tetrabutaline and bedrest.Yesterday, my best friend gave birth to a baby girl at 34 weeks.  She weighed 4lbs 9oz and was 18 1/2 in long.  She is breathing on her own...and took her first feeding earlier today....She is doing really well, but is still in the NICU....but the whole situation has me very worried about my own pregnancy.I always miscarry around 9 weeks....and obviously...I am coming up on this very shortly.  My first ultrasound isn't until 6/17...so until I have it...with a healthy report...I am extremely worried.  I am worried about having to go onto bedrest...I am worried about another miscarriage...I am worried about going into preterm labor again....What do you think ladies?  Do you think I am overreacting?  I try to tell myself to calm down....and stop worrying so much...but its hard.  Are any of you ladies worrying about the same things??
title: Worried....
